Hello,

Today was a great day! It was so fun seeing all of the kids and their excitement to be back in school. With all of the pieces that went well today, we are aware of the challenges that our pickup/drop-off procedure presented today. We are going to make the following changes starting immediately:

1. Buses will stay on the elementary side for both pickup and drop-off. Middle school bus kids will exit the bus in the morning and walk to the middle school. At dismissal, middle school bus kids will walk to the elementary side to get on the bus.

2. With buses staying at the elementary side, the middle school bus lane will now be an additional pickup lane for parents. This will help the congestion on Hesper and 64th.

3. If you are picking up students from both the elementary and middle school, please consider parking at the elementary and having your middle school student walk across to the elementary side.

Thank you for your understanding!

As most of you know, Kelsey Hunter, our elementary P.E. teacher is battling cancer. The PTO began Penny Wars as a new fundraiser this year, and in partnership with school staff, chose to donate all proceeds to Ms. Hunter.

Throughout the wars, the students had fun learning the art of sabotage and how different forms of money would affect their overall total. Our students competed by grade to see who could collect the most money with 5th grade winning collecting a total of $1,219.86.

With the amazing support and contributions from our great community we were able to raise $6,316.40 for Ms. Hunter! Thank you so much for your continued support in making The Grove the heart of our community.

Throughout the wars, the students had fun learning the art of sabotage and how different forms of money would affect their overall total. Our students competed by grade to see who could collect the most money with 5th grade winning collecting a total of $1,219.86.

With the amazing support and contributions from our great community we were able to raise $6,316.40 for Ms. Hunter! Thank you so much for your continued support in making The Grove the heart of our community.

Important: Please Read
From: Nurse Jen

It is that time of year...cold and flu season! We have had confirmed cases of both strep and influenza here at school. If your child has a fever, please do not send your child to school; please make an appointment to have your child seen by a provider. You and your provider can then make an informed decision whether or not to test for influenza. Antivirals such as Tamiflu and Relenza are most effective when given within 48 hours of symptom onset, so time is of the essence. Students should not return to school until they are fever free for 24 hours without the help of a fever reducer (Tylenol, Ibuprofen, etc), regardless of the diagnosis. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or concerns. You can email me at nurse@eldergrove.k12.mt.us or call 656-2893 ext 120. Thank you!

-Nurse Jen

We need your help! Please take the time to read about our new "Personal Care Closet."

They are looking to create hygiene kits, as well as individual items available to give students at that time. Unused travel items, like hotel shampoo/conditioners, as well as regular-sized items would be used to create a personal care closet here at school where kids can get the items they need year-round.

Here are some sample items we are looking to obtain:
soap, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, chapstick, toothpaste/brushes/mouthwash, deodorant, body wash, feminine hygiene products, combs/brushes, Q-tips...and anything else you might have handy!

The holidays and after are a great time with sales and clearance stock! There are boxes at each secretary's office, where you or your child can drop off items. They would like to have everything turned in by January 10th for the presentation, but will accept donations all year! Thank you so much!
